description: Omeprazole, a substituted benzimidazole, is an inhibitor of gastric acid secretion. It inhibits gastric acid secretion by blocking hydrogen-potassium-adenosine triphosphatase (H+/K+ ATPase) enzyme system in the gastric parietal cell. After oral administration, the onset of the antisecretory effect occurs within one hour, with the maximum effect occurring within two hours and inhibition of secretion lasts up to 72 hours. When the drug is discontinued, secretory activity returns gradually, over 3 to 5 days.
doses: 20 mg once daily for 4 weeks in duodenal ulceration, 8 weeks in gastric ulceration; in severe or recurrent cases, dose to be increased to 40 mg daily; maintenance dose for recurrent duodenal ulcer, 20 mg once daily; in prevention of relapse in duodenal ulcer, 10-20 mg daily.
actions: Inhibits the synthesis of prostaglandins in the brain.
warnings: Do not exceed 4000 mg per day

description: A common pain reliever and fever reducer.
actions: Inhibits the synthesis of prostaglandins in the brain.
warnings: Do not exceed 4000 mg per day

description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for pain relief, fever reduction, and anti-inflammatory effects.
actions: Inhibits cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes involved in prostaglandin synthesis.
warnings: Take with food to avoid stomach upset
Avoid in patients with heart disease

description: An antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections.
actions: Inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.
warnings: Complete the full course of treatment
May reduce the effectiveness of oral contraceptives

description: An antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms.
actions: Blocks histamine H1 receptors.

description: An ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
actions: Inhibits the angiotensin-converting enzyme.

description: A calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure and angina.
actions: Inhibits calcium ion influx into vascular smooth muscle and myocardium.

description: A medication used to treat type 2 diabetes by lowering glucose production in the liver.
actions: Decreases hepatic glucose production and increases insulin sensitivity.
warnings: Take with meals to reduce gastrointestinal effects

description: A statin used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart disease.
actions: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis.

description: A proton pump inhibitor used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and stomach ulcers.
actions: Inhibits the proton pump in gastric parietal cells, reducing acid production.

description: An angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) used to treat high blood pressure and protect the kidneys in diabetes.
actions: Blocks the effects of angiotensin II, lowering blood pressure.

description: A benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety disorders, alcohol withdrawal symptoms, muscle spasms, and seizures.
doses: 2-10 mg two to four times daily.
actions: Enhances the effect of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain.

description: A benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety disorders and panic attacks.
doses: 0.25-2 mg two to three times daily.
actions: Enhances the effect of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain.

description: An antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms such as sneezing, itching, watery eyes, or runny nose.
actions: Blocks histamine H1 receptors.

description: An antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections including urinary tract infections, pneumonia, and skin infections.
actions: Inhibits bacterial DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV.
warnings: May increase the risk of tendon rupture
Avoid in children and pregnant women

description: A proton pump inhibitor used to treat GERD, peptic ulcer disease, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.
actions: Inhibits the proton pump in gastric parietal cells, reducing acid production.

description: A beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, angina, and heart failure.
actions: Blocks beta-1 adrenergic receptors, reducing heart rate and contractility.

description: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), panic disorder, and social anxiety disorder.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin in the brain.
warnings: May increase suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: An atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder.
actions: Partial agonist at dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT1A receptors.
warnings: May increase the risk of suicidal thoughts in children and young adults
Monitor for signs of neuroleptic malignant syndrome

description: A leukotriene receptor antagonist used to prevent asthma and treat allergic rhinitis.
doses: 10 mg once daily in the evening.
actions: Blocks leukotriene receptors, reducing bronchoconstriction and inflammation.

description: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), bulimia nervosa, and panic disorder.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin in the brain.
warnings: May increase suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: An atypical antidepressant used to treat depression and aid smoking cessation.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of norepinephrine and dopamine.
warnings: May increase the risk of suicidal thoughts

description: A synthetic form of thyroxine (T4) used to treat hypothyroidism.
actions: Replaces or supplements endogenous thyroid hormones.
warnings: Individualize dose based on thyroid function tests

description: A thiazide diuretic used to treat high blood pressure and edema.
actions: Inhibits sodium reabsorption in the distal convoluted tubule.

description: A corticosteroid used to treat inflammation, allergic reactions, autoimmune diseases, and adrenal insufficiency.
actions: Suppresses inflammation and the immune response.

description: A corticosteroid used to treat inflammation, allergic reactions, autoimmune diseases, and adrenal insufficiency.
actions: Suppresses inflammation and the immune response.

description: An anticoagulant used to prevent blood clots and stroke.
actions: Inhibits the synthesis of vitamin K-dependent clotting factors.

description: A beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, angina, and heart failure.
actions: Blocks beta-1 adrenergic receptors, reducing heart rate and contractility.

description: A corticosteroid used to treat asthma, allergic rhinitis, and nasal polyps.
actions: Suppresses inflammation in the airways.

description: An opioid analgesic used to treat moderate to severe pain.
doses: Immediate-release: 10-30 mg every 4 hours. Extended-release: 10-200 mg once daily.
actions: Binds to mu-opioid receptors in the CNS, altering the perception of pain.

description: A short-acting beta-agonist bronchodilator used to treat asthma and COPD.
doses: 90 mcg inhalation every 4-6 hours as needed.
actions: Stimulates beta-2 adrenergic receptors in the airway smooth muscle, resulting in bronchodilation.

description: A benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety disorders, insomnia, and seizures.
doses: 1-4 mg divided into 2-3 doses per day.
actions: Enhances the effect of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain.

description: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin in the brain.
warnings: May increase suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: A serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) used to treat depression, anxiety disorders, and panic disorder.
doses: 75-225 mg divided into 2-3 doses per day.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain.
warnings: May increase suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: An atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and irritability associated with autism.
actions: Antagonizes dopamine and serotonin receptors in the brain.
warnings: May increase the risk of suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: An atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder.
actions: Antagonizes dopamine and serotonin receptors in the brain.
warnings: May increase the risk of suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: A non-selective beta-blocker and alpha-1 blocker used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
actions: Blocks beta-1, beta-2, and alpha-1 adrenergic receptors.

description: A corticosteroid used to treat asthma, allergic rhinitis, and inflammatory bowel disease.
actions: Suppresses inflammation in the airways.

description: A serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) used to treat depression, anxiety disorders, fibromyalgia, and chronic pain.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain.
warnings: May increase suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin in the brain.
warnings: May increase suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: An opioid analgesic used to treat moderate to moderately severe pain.
doses: Immediate-release: 50-100 mg every 4-6 hours. Extended-release: 100-300 mg once daily.
actions: Binds to mu-opioid receptors in the CNS, altering the perception of pain.

description: A statin used to treat high cholesterol and reduce the risk of cardiovascular events.
actions: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis.

description: An angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and diabetic nephropathy.
actions: Inhibits ACE, preventing the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II.

description: A biguanide antidiabetic used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus.
actions: Decreases hepatic glucose production and increases insulin sensitivity.

description: A serotonin 5-HT3 receptor antagonist used to prevent nausea and vomiting associated with chemotherapy and surgery.
doses: 8-16 mg 30 minutes before chemotherapy or surgery.
actions: Blocks serotonin 5-HT3 receptors in the gut and central nervous system.
uses: Nausea and vomiting associated with chemotherapy
warnings: Monitor ECG in patients with electrolyte abnormalities

description: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as respiratory tract infections and skin infections.
actions: Inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.
warnings: Use with caution in penicillin-sensitive patients

description: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
actions: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin in the brain.
warnings: May increase suicidal thoughts in children and young adults

description: A macrolide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as respiratory tract infections, skin infections, and sexually transmitted infections.
doses: 500 mg once daily for 3 days or 500 mg on day 1 followed by 250 mg once daily for 4 days.
actions: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 50S ribosomal subunit.
warnings: Monitor for signs of hepatic injury

description: A nitroimidazole antibiotic used to treat bacterial and protozoal infections such as bacterial vaginosis, trichomoniasis, and Helicobacter pylori infection.
actions: Inhibits nucleic acid synthesis in susceptible organisms.
warnings: Avoid during first trimester of pregnancy

description: A tetracycline antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as acne, respiratory tract infections, and Lyme disease.
actions: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S ribosomal subunit.
warnings: May cause tooth discoloration in children

description: A penicillin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, and skin infections.
actions: Inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.
warnings: Use with caution in penicillin-sensitive patients

description: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as urinary tract infections, respiratory tract infections, and skin infections.
actions: Inhibits bacterial DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV.
warnings: May cause tendinitis and tendon rupture

description: A leukotriene receptor antagonist used to prevent and treat asthma and allergies.
doses: 10 mg once daily in the evening.
actions: Blocks leukotriene receptors, reducing inflammation and bronchoconstriction.
warnings: Monitor for changes in mood or behavior

description: A combination medication used to treat mild to moderate pain and reduce fever. The caffeine component enhances the pain-relieving effects of paracetamol.
doses: 1-2 tablets every 4-6 hours as needed, not to exceed 8 tablets in 24 hours.
actions: Paracetamol acts as an analgesic and antipyretic, while caffeine acts as a central nervous system stimulant.
warnings: May cause severe liver damage if taken in high doses

description: A combination medication used to improve blood sugar control in adults with type 2 diabetes. Sitagliptin is a DPP-4 inhibitor and metformin is a biguanide.
doses: 50 mg sitagliptin / 500 mg metformin twice daily with meals.
actions: Sitagliptin increases insulin release and decreases glucagon levels, while metformin decreases hepatic glucose production and increases insulin sensitivity.

description: An antispasmodic agent used to treat irritable bowel syndrome and other gastrointestinal disorders.
doses: 30 mg three times daily before meals.
actions: Regulates bowel motility by modulating the activity of gastrointestinal smooth muscles.
warnings: Avoid driving or operating machinery if affected

description: A vitamin D supplement used to treat or prevent vitamin D deficiency.
actions: Increases intestinal absorption of calcium and phosphate, promoting bone mineralization.
warnings: Avoid excessive intake to prevent toxicity

description: A proton pump inhibitor (PPI) used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and peptic ulcers.
doses: 20 mg once daily, at least one hour before a meal.
actions: Suppresses gastric acid secretion by inhibiting the H+/K+ ATPase pump in the gastric parietal cells.
warnings: May increase risk of Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea
Long-term use may increase risk of bone fractures

description: A dopamine receptor antagonist used to treat nausea and vomiting.
doses: 10-20 mg 3-4 times daily before meals and at bedtime.
actions: Blocks dopamine receptors in the chemoreceptor trigger zone, reducing nausea and vomiting.
warnings: Use with caution in patients with heart conditions

description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain and inflammation in conditions such as arthritis and menstrual pain.
actions: Inhibits cyclooxygenase enzyme, thereby reducing prostaglandin synthesis.
warnings: May increase risk of heart attack or stroke

description: A calcium supplement used to prevent or treat calcium deficiencies and to support bone health.
doses: 500-1500 mg once or twice daily, preferably with meals.
actions: Supplements dietary calcium intake to maintain bone strength and prevent osteoporosis.
warnings: Take with plenty of water to prevent constipation

description: A calcium supplement used to prevent or treat calcium deficiencies and to support bone health.
doses: 500-1200 mg once or twice daily, preferably with meals.
actions: Supplements dietary calcium intake to maintain bone strength and prevent osteoporosis.
warnings: Take with plenty of water to prevent constipation
